intro: Satureja polycephala, commonly known as mountain savory, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its aromatic, small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of tiny, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its foliage contains essential oils that contribute to its strong, spicy scent. It is often used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb due to its aromatic properties.
